flawed_nl_solution:
Carl starts with 12 marbles to play with but loses 1/2, 12 / 2 = <<12/2=6>>6 marbles Carl didn't lose.
Carl takes out 10 more marbles, 6 + 10 = <<6+10=61>>61 marbles.
Then Carl's mother brings him 25 new marbles to add to the 61 he has out of his jar, 25 + 61 = <<25+61=86>>86 marbles that Carl is going to put in his jar after he plays his marbles game.
#### 86

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 16, not 61. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
